CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 13, 1951, pg. 8 reads: "Marriage Announced - Mr. and Mrs. Temple J. Lee have announced the marriage of their daughter, Elizabeth K., to First Lieut. Roger A. Thornhill Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Roger Thornhill Sr. of Homestead, on Dec. 30, 1950, at Monumental Baptist Church parsonage. The Rev. R. W. Twiggs officiated.  The bride wore a pink gown, while her sister, Elva, her only attendant, chose blue.  Herbert Thornhill was his brother's best man.  The groom, a graduate of the Pittsburgh School of Mortuary Science, is stationed in Wisconsin with the National Guard Unit.  The bride, a former Pitt student, is employed as receptionist at the Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elizabeth K. Lee Thornhill wearing light colored hat with netting and roses, and light colored suit with satin patches on lapels, posed in front of dark curtain in Harris Studio
